intro: Platytaenia bucharica, commonly known as the Bukharan bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or alpine settings. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
